text: Seo Su-yeon (, born January 8, 1986) is a South Korean para table tennis player. She won a silver medal and a bronze at the 2016 Summer Paralympics. She is coached by Cho Jae-kwan. When she was 18, Seo aspired to be a model and visited a hospital to correct her posture. Instead, she was paralysed by an injection. She began playing table tennis while she fought the hospital in courts. ==References== Category:1986 births Category:Sportspeople from South Jeolla Province Category:South Korean female table tennis players Category:Table tennis players at the 2016 Summer Paralympics Category:Medalists at the 2016 Summer Paralympics Category:Living people Category:People with paraplegia Category:Paralympic silver medalists for South Korea Category:Paralympic bronze medalists for South Korea Category:Paralympic medalists in table tennis Category:Paralympic table tennis players of South Korea Category:People from Mokpo
title: Seo Su-yeon
